page.title: 17Colvend: Recreation
page.content: The Solway Yacht Club is based at Kippford,but sailing takes place in the Rough Firth. When the tide is out the yachts sit high and dry on the mud of the river estuary. The Club has about 200 members. The first race is the Spring Handicap. In the Summer holidays is Cadet Week,then Kippford Week.Both sailing weeks are for five days.The last sailing week- end is the Autumn Handicap. Handicap means different boats in the same race. There are many kinds of yachts in the Club - Cadets,Mirrors,Lasers and GP's. Cadets are also young people under eighteen. I am a Cadet and I sail in a Cadet yacht. When the Cadets go out other men come out in bigger yachts to keep an eye on us.I like sailing.
